title: Green and Gold Lunch
description:
Don your USF spirit gear and come to enjoy a pop up lunch with faculty, staff and students.  The pizza oven will be firing up delicious flatbreads and other options are available for sale.  If a spirit ambassador spots you in USF or green and gold apparel, you may be gifted with a meal voucher that you can use at any USF cafe!

This event is open to all USF community members.

title: Navigating College Together: Supporting Your Student’s Journey
description:
We’re excited to launch Navigating College Together: Supporting Your Student’s Journey, a workshop series created for USF parents and family members. Each session will offer practical tools, helpful insights, and campus resources to guide you in supporting your student’s success at USF. Sessions will be held virtually on Wednesdays at 5:30 PM.

Zoom Meeting Link: https://usfca.zoom.us/j/84507763283

Check out the schedule below - we look forward to the many conversations!


Workshop #1:  Wednesday, September 24

Workshop Title: When Homesickness Hits: What Families Need to Know

Workshop Description: Starting college is a big step not only for students, but for families too. This interactive session will share practical tools and insights to help you support your student, while also giving you space to reflect on your own experience during this transition.

Workshop #2:  Wednesday, October 1

Workshop Title: Off-Campus Housing Informational

Workshop Description: Please join us for an Off-Campus Housing 101 Workshop. We will talk about rent prices, neighborhoods, navigating the housing search process, booking individual appointments for support, and answer some of your questions.

Workshop #3:  Wednesday, October 8

Workshop Title: From Curriculum to Career: Why Internships and LinkedIn are the Keys to Your Student’s Success

Workshop Description:  Alex Hochman, the Senior Director of Career Services, will discuss why internships are critical for a student's long-term career success and show how USF students have access to thousands of unique internship postings. Also, prepare to be dazzled by LinkedIn strategies to find and utilize alumni mentors and employment opportunities.

Workshop #4:  Wednesday, October 15

Workshop Title: One Must Travel to Learn: Studying Abroad at USF

Workshop Description: Learn about international opportunities available to students for a semester, an academic year, or additional short-term options. The presentation will cover the application process, eligibility, costs, and programs available through USF. The second half of the workshop will feature study abroad returnees to share their experiences from abroad and answer any questions.

Workshop #5: Wednesday, October 22

Workshop Title: Anxiety Management -- Yours and Theirs

Workshop Description: In this session hosted by Counseling and Psychological Services (CAPS), we will differentiate between stress, anxiety, and panic for you and your student. We will provide resources and practical exercises to combat everyday anxieties.

Workshop #6: Wednesday, October 29

Workshop Title: Jumpstart Your Wellness: A Family Guide to Student Health at USF

Workshop Description: Learn how Health Promotion Services (HPS) supports the well-being of the USF student body through a comprehensive range of programs and services. Dedicated to fostering a safe, healthy, and vibrant campus community, HPS empowers students to thrive personally and academically.

title: USF Market Day
description:
Fresh food and produce, farmer's market style!

Shop FREE produce from Star Route Farms (for current USF students) while sampling local products and enjoying music from a live KUSF DJ! You can also learn more about USF's Food Pantry, ASUSF Senate, Office of Sustainability, Bon Appetit programs, and Student Leadership and Engagement (SLE).


This event is open to all USF community members.

title: 15th Annual Critical Diversity Studies Forum
description:
Register Now

We are excited to share this year’s 15th Annual Critical Diversity Studies Forum on Thursday, October 2nd, 2:40p- 4:25p in McLaren. This theme in our celebratory year is "We Keep Us Safe."

"We Keep Us Safe" is a call to action from community organizers, disability justice practitioners, abolitionists, queer, immigrant, and BIPOC communities who have demonstrated that we all deserve more safety and justice than our current systems provide.  In our increasingly uncertain and volatile times, we invite all of us to create true safety by nurturing relationships of collective care, mutual aid, and solidarity while refusing binaries of “us vs. them.”  “We Keep Us Safe" is an invitation to radically envision collective safety: as a shared responsibility to love and protect each other, especially those most impacted by injustice.

This year’s Forum will feature Yosimar Reyes (writer, poet, performer and Santa Clara Poet Laureate), Terisa Siagatonu (award-winning poet, teaching artist, mental health educator, and community leader), and Zachary Norris (former executive director of the Ella Baker Center for Human Rights, author, organizer, and advocate).
